references.reason: This paper is foundational for the field of diffusion models, introducing the core concepts and algorithms used in the image-to-video generation models discussed in the paper.

references.paper_title: High-resolution image synthesis with latent diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces a significant advancement in diffusion models, enabling the generation of high-resolution images which is highly relevant to the image-to-video task.

references.paper_title: Learning transferable visual models from natural language supervision
references.reason: CLIP, introduced in this paper, is a crucial component of many image-to-video models, providing a way to connect image features to textual descriptions, which influences how the models are conditioned and trained.

references.paper_title: Stable video diffusion: Scaling latent video diffusion models to large datasets
references.reason: This paper presents a state-of-the-art approach to video diffusion, scaling the models to large datasets and directly addresses some of the challenges related to motion generation, which the paper aims to improve upon.

references.paper_title: Imagen video: High definition video generation with diffusion models
references.reason: This paper introduces a model for high-fidelity video generation which is directly relevant to and builds the foundation for the image-to-video models described in the paper.
